intro: Ouratea luanoensis, commonly known as the Luano evergreen, is a species of flowering plant in the family Ochnaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and clusters of small, white flowers that bloom throughout the year. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. The leaves are elliptical, leathery, and have a glossy appearance, making it a visually striking plant in its native habitat.
